snippet: Researchers say that stopping leaks of methane, a potent greenhouse gas, is a major untapped opportunity for combating climate change.
abstract: Report commissioned by Environmental Defense Fund says curbing methane leaks from oil and gas projects worldwide could provide inexpensive way to battle climate change; methane, strong greenhouse gas, totaled 3.6 billion cubic feet in leaks in 2012, worth $30 billion.
lead_paragraph: Researchers say that stopping leaks of methane, a potent greenhouse gas, is a major untapped opportunity for combating climate change.

headline.main: Study Finds Low Cost in Reducing Methane Emissions
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Low Cost in Reducing Methane Emissions
